features.featureTitle:
Replace the current portfolio site branding and homepage structure with an ecommerce storefront for the brand "South Essentials", using the tagline exactly: "your one stop shop for south indian products".

Update all prominent user-facing branding (top navigation brand text, hero heading/wordmark text, primary CTA text) to reflect "South Essentials" and the tagline, and remove/replace portfolio-specific content ("Hariharan Ramani", writer-focused copy, services/about writer bio) so the site reads as a shop homepage.

Implement a simple, static ecommerce browsing experience (no external payments) on a single-page React UI, including:
- A “Featured Categories” (or equivalent) section that highlights: South Indian temples, silk sarees, South Indian snacks, and traditional South Indian dance forms.
- A “Products” section that lists a small default set of products (static data stored in a frontend content/data file) with name, price, image, and category.
- A client-side cart (local state) allowing add/remove items and showing quantity and subtotal.
- A checkout action that is clearly labeled as a placeholder (e.g., “Checkout (Coming Soon)”) and does not integrate any payment provider.

Update navigation links to scroll to the new storefront sections.

Generate and include default themed images representing: South Indian temples, silk sarees, South Indian snacks, and traditional South Indian dance forms. Store these images under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them as category and/or hero imagery in the storefront UI (no backend image routing).

Update basic SEO and sharing metadata in frontend/index.html to match the new storefront branding:
- Title should include "South Essentials".
- Description should describe the storefront in English and include the tagline text.
- Update Open Graph and Twitter metadata to match the new title/description.
